titlestmt.titleproper: William R. Mathews collection of correspondence with and recollections of John Foster Dulles 1941-1964
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: William R. Mathews collection of correspondence with and recollections of John Foster Dulles
did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: William R. Mathews (1893-1969) was the editor and publisher of the Arizona Daily Star. John Foster Dulles (1888-1959) served as U.S. Secretary of State under President Dwight D. Eisenhower from 1953 to 1959.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of letters between William R. Mathews and John Foster Dulles, 1941 to 1957. The two men exchanged thoughts on foreign policy, from the lead-up to American involvement in the war in Europe to the Korean War. The collection also includes Mathews's diary of Dulles's 1950 trip to Korea, for which Mathews was a correspondent. The collection includes excerpts of Dulles addresses that the Secretary of State sent to Mathews. There are also several pamphlets authored by Dulles, and several newspaper clippings. The collection also includes several letters from Dulles's widow to Mathews (1961-1964).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
